intro: Erigeron salsuginosus var. howellii, commonly known as Howell's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, daisy-like blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is drought-tolerant, making it well adapted to harsh climates. The species is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
